heading: 2.5.2 Lactose intolerane
text: Lactose intolerane occurs due deficiency lactase enzyme. common reason lactase non-persistence genotype seen among many populations around world. enzyme lactase responsible digestion lactose present childhood expression declines age populations. populations express lactase enzyme well adulthood due genetic mutation capable digesting lactose. Less commonly transient decrease lactase enzyme due intestinal diseases can lead transient lactose intolerance. Rarely, congenital deficiency lactase enzyme can lead lactose intolerance infants.Clinical features lactose intolerance includes bloating, abdominal pain, diarrhea consuming milk milk containing products. Undigested lactose osmotically active causes increased secretion water intestine leading diarrhea. Undigested lactose also fermented large intestinal bacteria releasing gases intestine causing distension bloating abdomen. Treatment involves avoiding milk milk containing food, required lactase enzyme supplementation.

text: Certain carbohydrate non-carbohydrates present plant food indigestible called dietar fibres. Examples: Cellulose, hemicellulose, pectin lignin. Dietary sources include cereals, whole grains, vegetables, fruits, legumes, bran, nuts. fibres delay gastric emptying causes increased satiety thus reducing amount food intake. fibres absorb water increase bulk stool eases defecation thus preventing constipation. Increased satiety helps weight reduction. Reduced rate absorption glucose due fibres beneficial people diabetes mellitus.benefits include reduction cholesterol level reduced risk colon cancer.

heading: 4.2 Citric acid cycle
text: Citric acid cycle final metabolic pathway produces energy carbohydrates, proteins, lipids. Citric acid cycle occurs aerobic conditions. names cycle Kreb’s cycle, tricarboxylic acid (TCA) cycle. series 8 chemical reactions mitochondria generates energy complete oxidation acetyl-CoA two carbon dioxide molecules reducing 3 NAD+ 1 FADH2. reaction starts consumption oxaloacetate ends regeneration oxaloacetate. Thus oxaloacetate technically catalyst TCA cycyle required small concentration.turn cycle reduces 3 NAD+ 3 NADH 1 FADH 1 FADH2 molecules along substrate level phosphorylation produce GTP. NADH capable producing 2.5 ATPs, FADH2 capable producing 1.5 ATPs. Thus turn cycle produces 10 ATPs (2.5 * 3 NADH + 1.5 * 1 FADH2 + 1 ATP (= 1 GTP)).

heading: 4.3 Amphibolic pathway
text: Citric acid cycle amphibolic pathway .e., anabolic catabolic functions. catabolic since final oxidation pathway carbohydrates, proteins, lipids prodduces ATP. anabolic intermediate molecules citric acid cycle used sources carbons synthesis glucose, amino acids, fatty acids, heme, nucleotides. Anabolic reactions consume TCA cycle intermediates also called cataplerotic reactions. Reactions replenish TCA cycle intermediates sustain TCA cycle called anaplerotic reactions. Glucogenic amino acids replenish TCA cyle intermediates anaplerotic reactions.

heading: 8.5 Symptoms of hypoglycemia
text:
Symptoms hypoglycemia due 
- Symptoms autonomic nervous system hunger,sweating,palpitations, anxiety, tremor
- Symptoms due glucose deprivation brain headache, fatigue, weakness, blurry vision, dizziness, irritability. severe symptoms include seizures, coma ultimately death untreated.

heading: 9 Diabetes mellitus
text: Diabetes mellitus metabolic condition characterised hyperglycaemia (high blood glucose level) due defective insulin secretion, insulin action, . Hyperglycaemia can lead acute chronic complications. Long standing hyperglycaemia affects multiple organs leading chronic complications.

heading: 9.1 Prevalence of diabetes mellitus
text: 537 million people living diabetes globally per International Diabetes Federation around 100 million India. One 10 adults India suffer Diabetes mellitus making signficant public health problem.

heading: 9.2.1 Type 1 diabetes mellitus
text: Type 1 diabetes mellitus occurs due autoimmune destruction β-cells pancreas leading absolute deficiency insulin. Type 1 diabetes accounts 5-10% cases diabetes mellitus. Type 1 diabetes usually develops younger age.

heading: 9.2.2 Type 2 diabetes mellitus
text: Type 2 diabetes mellitus characterised relative insulin deficiency .e., insulin secreted lesser amount required body. Action insulin impaired type 2 diabetes (insulin resistance) progressive decrease insulin secretion beta-cells. Type 2 diabetes usually develops older age (>35 years). Multiple genetic environmental factors including obesity Iincreases risk Type 2 diabetes mellitus.

heading: 9.2.3 Gestational diabetes mellitus
text: GDM defined diabetes diagnosed first time second third trimester pregnancy.

heading: 9.2.4 Specific types of diabetes mellitus
text: Specific types diabetes mellitus due specific causes :Genetic defects insulin secretion (Maturity Onset Diabetes Young)Genetic defects insulin actionDiseases exocrine pancreasEndocrine disordersDrug induced diabetes

heading: 9.3 Clinical features of diabetes mellitus
text: Following classical signs diabetes mellitusPolyphagia – Increased hungerPolydipsia – Increased thirstPolyuria – Increased urinationWeight lossPatients can also present acute chronic complications diabetes mellitus

heading: 9.4.1.1 Diabetic ketoacidosis
text:
Usually occurs untreated poorly controlled diabetes mellitus patients. common Type 1 diabetes mellitus. Diabetic ketoacidosis characterised increased production metabolite called ketone bodies. Ketone bodies acids leads acidosis.
also characterised high levels blood glucose dehydration.

heading: 9.4.1.2 Hyperosmolar hyperglycaemic state
text:
Occurs mostly type 2 diabetes mellitus characterised 
high levels blood glucose, dehydration without increased levels ketone bodies. can lead coma.

heading: 9.4.2.1 Microvascular complications
text: OccurS due damage small blood vessels supplying various organs.Diabetic retinopathy: Diabetic retinopathy leading cause blindness adults.affects capillaries retina.Diabetic retinopathy: Diabetic retinopathy leading cause blindness adults.affects capillaries retina.Diabetic nephropathy: Diabetic nephropathy common cause chronic kidney disease. affects glomerulus characterized excretion protein urine (proteinuria).Diabetic nephropathy: Diabetic nephropathy common cause chronic kidney disease. affects glomerulus characterized excretion protein urine (proteinuria).Diabetic neuropathy: Diabetes can damage nerve fibers resulting sensory neuropathy, autonomic neuropathy.Clinical manifestations include loss sensation, numbness, tingling sensation, pain, orthostatic hypotension etc.Diabetic neuropathy: Diabetes can damage nerve fibers resulting sensory neuropathy, autonomic neuropathy.Clinical manifestations include loss sensation, numbness, tingling sensation, pain, orthostatic hypotension etc.

heading: 9.4.2.2 Macrovascular complications
text: Macrovascular complications ococurs due damage large blood vessels supplying various organs.Heart: Coronary artery disease. Diabetes mellitus increases risk cardiovascular diseases several times compared people without diabetes.Hyperglycaemia along dyslipidaemia factors promote formation atherosclerosis leading cardiovascular diseases.Heart: Coronary artery disease. Diabetes mellitus increases risk cardiovascular diseases several times compared people without diabetes.Hyperglycaemia along dyslipidaemia factors promote formation atherosclerosis leading cardiovascular diseases.Limbs: Peripheral vascular disease. Affects foot, leg, intestine etc.Limbs: Peripheral vascular disease. Affects foot, leg, intestine etc.Brain: Damage blood vessel supplying brain leads strokeBrain: Damage blood vessel supplying brain leads stroke

heading: Hexosamine pathway

Lipid profile

Regular monitoring lipid profile management aids reducing risk developing macrovascular complications.

heading: 9.6 Principles of treatment of diabetes mellitus
text: Aim treatment maintain blood glucose level within target levels prevent complications. involves regular monitoring glycaemic control. can achieved combination lifestyle modifications pharmacological interventions. Lifestyle modifications include modifications diet physical activity, smoking alcohol cessation. Pharmacological interventions include oral hypoglycaemic agents act multiple mechanisms e.g., Sulfonylurea class drugs increase insulin secretion.type 1 diabetes uncontrolled type 2 diabetes, insulin injections necessary.

heading: 11 Fructose metabolism
text: Fructose present fruit juices, honey, cane sugar etc. Cells can use fructose fuel directly converting glucose.Fructose can enter glycolysis produce ATP either hexokinase fructokinase aldolase B.

heading: 11.2 Fructose metabolism through fructokinase and Aldolase B
11.3.1 Essential fructosuria
text: Occurs due genetic defect enzyme fructokinase. characterized increased excretion fructose urine benign condition.

heading: 11.3.2 Hereditary fructose intolerance
text: Occurs due genetic defect enzyme aldolase B. characterized hypoglycemia, hepatomegaly, jaundice kidney disease. Symptoms occur due consumption inorganic phosphate conversion fructose fructose-1-phosphate.

heading: 11.4 Sorbitol pathway
text: Glucose can converted fructose liver, testis seminal vesicles. Fructose produced seminal vesicles act source energy sperm cells. Diabetes Mellitus, accumulation sorbitol causes osmotic damage tissues leading cataract, retinopathy, nephropathy neuropathy.

heading: 12 Galactose metabolism
text: Galactose utilized fuel cells converted glucose. Galactose synthesized mammary glands production lactose milk.

heading: 12.2.1 Galactokinase deficiency
text: Leads increased levels galactose blood (galactosemia) urine (galactosuria).Increased levels galactose leads formation galactitol lens causes cataract.

heading: 12.2.2 Classical galactosemia
text:
